meanings.definition: Lack of wisdom or good judgment.
meanings.sent1: His unwisdom in spending all his money on unnecessary things led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The unwisdom of ignoring advice from experienced individuals became evident when the project failed.
meanings.sent3: The unwisdom of trying to fit a square peg into a round hole was clear to everyone watching.
meanings.sent4: Her unwisdom in trusting a known liar was like walking into a trap blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The unwisdom of walking alone in a dark forest without a flashlight was a recipe for disaster.

meanings.sent1: His unwisdom in skipping classes resulted in poor grades.
meanings.sent2: The unwisdom of driving without a seatbelt is a risk no one should take.
meanings.sent3: The unwisdom of trying to juggle too many tasks at once was comical to observe.
meanings.sent4: Her unwisdom in believing she could fly without wings was like a scene from a cartoon.
meanings.sent5: The unwisdom of challenging a professional boxer to a match was a decision he soon regretted.
